ground_truth: She leaps out of bed, throwing on a robe. Evelyn starts quickly for the bathroom, then comes back and kneels by the side of the bed, taking Gittes' hand. Then he leaps out of bed, rummages around, and tosses on his trousers. He grabs his shoes, throws them on, and hurries out of the bedroom, running across the driveway to the garage. There are two cars there: Mulwray's Buick and Evelyn's Packard. Gittes moves over to the Buick, opens the passenger's door, and kicks at the right rear taillight of the car with the heel of his shoe, shattering the red lens. He gets up, carefully pulls the red lens off the taillight, exposing the white light beneath it, tosses the red lens into the shrubbery, and hurries back toward the house. Evelyn's car speeds along the curves on Sunset Boulevard, the red and white lights coming in and out of view, with Gittes behind the wheel of Mulwray's car, keeping a healthy distance from Evelyn in front of him. He pulls up before a small bungalow house and she hurries up the walkway to the front door, while he brings the car a few yards further down the street, parking it near Evelyn's, and idles the engine with the lights off. Gittes gets out of the car and goes up the walkway, where the curtains are drawn except for one of the small windows on the side of the house. He goes to it and looks, balancing on the edge of the porch, and sees Evelyn's Oriental servant rushing through the living room of the small house, where the windows have blinds. He moves to one where the blind is not completely drawn, finding an inch or so of space at the bottom. Evelyn is pacing back and forth in and out of his line of vision. After a moment, someone rises into sight, obviously from lying on a bed: Mulwray's girlfriend, just a few feet from Evelyn. Her tear-stained face comes into view as Evelyn kneels, and the girl looks up to Evelyn, speaking in Spanish. Gittes continues to watch as the servant re-emerges through the living room carrying a tray with a glass and pitcher on it. Evelyn insists that the girl swallow down some pills, which the girl reluctantly does, before emerging from the house, going to her car, and getting in. Evelyn sees Gittes sitting in her car, staring coldly at her. As Gittes starts to get out of the car, Evelyn grabs his arm, nearly screaming, with her intensity actually ripping Gittes' already partially torn jacket. He looks at it and her, which has a momentary calming effect on both of them, before Evelyn's head sinks onto the steering wheel, her hair covering her face.

Evelyn gives her pills to swallow. Emerging, Evelyn sees Gittes in her car. She grabs his arm urgently, nearly tearing his jacket. Calmed briefly, Evelyn's head collapses onto the steering wheel.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Evelyn abruptly leaps out of her bed, hastily throwing on a comfortable robe. With urgency, she starts swiftly toward the bathroom. Suddenly, she pauses, turns back, and kneels deliberately by the side of the bed, gently taking Gittes' hand into her own. In response, Gittes quickly leaps out of the bed himself, frantically rummaging around for his clothes. He hurriedly tosses on his trousers, grabs hold of his shoes, and hastily throws them on his feet. With little time to spare, he rushes out of the bedroom, sprinting directly across the driveway to where the garage is located. Inside the garage, there are two distinct cars parked: Mulwray's Buick and Evelyn's Packard. Gittes decisively moves over to the Buick, opening the passenger door with clear intent. Using the heel of his shoe, he kicks forcefully at the right rear taillight of the car, causing the red lens to shatter. Proceeding with caution, he gets up, carefully removing the broken red lens from the taillight, which exposes the white light beneath it. He tosses the shattered red lens into the surrounding shrubbery and hurries back toward the house with swift determination. Meanwhile, Evelyn's car speeds along the winding curves of Sunset Boulevard, with the red and white lights flickering in and out of view. Gittes is diligently following behind the wheel of Mulwray's car, maintaining a safe and healthy distance from Evelyn, who is ahead of him on the road. He eventually pulls up in front of a modest-looking bungalow house, as Evelyn hurriedly makes her way up the walkway toward the front door. Gittes drives the car a few more yards further down the street, carefully parking it near Evelyn's vehicle, and allows the engine to idle quietly with the lights turned off. He steps out of the car and walks cautiously up the walkway to the house, where the curtains are drawn, except for one of the small windows on the side. He approaches it and peers inside, balancing precariously on the edge of the porch. In his view, he observes Evelyn's Oriental servant rushing through the small house's living room, where the windows have blinds pulled down. Searching for a better view, he moves to a window where the blinds are not completely drawn, finding a narrow inch or so of space at the bottom. Evelyn is pacing back and forth repeatedly, moving in and out of his line of vision. After a brief moment, someone comes into view, rising from what appears to be a lying position on a bed: Mulwray's girlfriend, just a few feet away from Evelyn. Her face, stained with tears, comes into clear view as Evelyn kneels beside her, and the girl looks up at Evelyn, speaking softly in Spanish. Gittes continues to watch intently as the servant comes back through the living room, carrying a tray that holds a glass and a pitcher. Evelyn insists that the girl take some pills, which the girl reluctantly swallows, before emerging from the house, making her way to her car, and getting inside. Evelyn then notices Gittes sitting in her car, his gaze fixed coldly upon her. As Gittes begins to exit the car, Evelyn frantically grabs his arm, nearly screaming with such intensity that she actually rips Gittes' already partially torn jacket. He looks at the damage and then at her, which has a calming effect on both of them, albeit momentarily. Finally, Evelyn's head sinks heavily onto the steering wheel, her hair cascading down to obscure her face.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Evelyn, with a sudden jolt, leaps out of her bed with urgency, hurriedly throwing on a comfortable, familiar robe. With a sense of immediacy, she strides swiftly toward the bathroom, her thoughts racing. Abruptly, she pauses in her tracks, turns back with deliberate intent, and kneels gently beside the bed. With a tender, caring touch, she takes Gittes' hand into her own, looking at him intently. In response to her actions, Gittes, with equal swiftness, leaps out of the bed himself, frantically searching for his scattered clothes in a bit of a frenzy. He quickly tosses on his trousers in haste, grabs hold of his shoes with determination, and hurriedly slips them onto his feet. With time pressing heavily upon them, he rushes out of the bedroom, sprinting directly across the driveway with purpose to reach the garage's location. Inside the spacious garage, two distinct cars are neatly parked: Mulwray's Buick and Evelyn's elegant Packard. Gittes makes a quick, decisive move toward the Buick, opening the passenger door with clear intent in his eyes. Utilizing the heel of his shoe, he kicks forcefully at the right rear taillight of the car, shattering the red lens into pieces. Proceeding with caution and precision, he rises, meticulously removing the broken red lens from the taillight, thereby revealing the white light underneath. He casually tosses the shattered remnants of the red lens into the thick surrounding shrubbery and hurries back toward the house with unwavering determination and swift steps. Meanwhile, Evelyn's car is speeding along the winding, serpentine curves of Sunset Boulevard, with the alternating red and white lights flickering and disappearing intermittently from view. Gittes diligently follows closely behind the wheel of Mulwray's car, carefully maintaining a safe and prudent distance from Evelyn, who is ahead of him on the road. Eventually, he pulls up in front of a modest-looking bungalow house, as Evelyn hurriedly makes her way up the walkway toward the front entrance. Gittes drives the car a few more yards further down the street, carefully parking it near Evelyn's vehicle, allowing the engine to idle quietly with the headlights turned off to avoid drawing attention. He steps out of the car cautiously and walks deliberately up the walkway to the house, where the curtains are tightly drawn, except for one of the small windows on the side. He approaches it with a sense of curiosity and peers inside, balancing precariously on the edge of the porch for a better view. Through his careful observation, he sees Evelyn's Oriental servant rushing through the living room of the small house, where the blinds are pulled down, blocking most of the view. In search of a clearer line of sight, he moves over to a window where the blinds are not entirely drawn down, finding a narrow inch or so of space at the bottom that offers a different perspective. Evelyn is pacing back and forth incessantly, moving in and out of his line of vision without ceasing. After a brief moment passes, someone comes into view, rising from what seems to be a supine position on a bed: Mulwray's girlfriend, just a few feet away from Evelyn in close proximity. Her face, stained with tears, becomes visible as Evelyn kneels beside her, and the girl looks up at Evelyn, speaking softly in Spanish, her words filled with emotion. Gittes continues to watch intently and observes as the servant comes back through the living room, carrying a tray that holds a glass and a pitcher, moving with practiced ease. Evelyn insists that the girl take some pills, which the girl reluctantly swallows with hesitation, before emerging from the house, making her way over to her car, and getting inside. Evelyn then notices Gittes sitting in her car, his gaze fixed coldly and intensely upon her. As Gittes begins to exit the car with a sense of resolve, Evelyn frantically grabs his arm with urgency, nearly screaming with such intensity that she ends up tearing Gittes' already partially torn jacket even further. He looks at the damage with slight astonishment and then turns his gaze toward her, which has an unexpectedly calming effect on both of them, albeit only for a moment. Finally, Evelyn's head sinks heavily onto the steering wheel, her silky hair cascading down to obscure her face from view, creating a veil of privacy even in their shared presence.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She abruptly awakens and energetically leaps out of bed, swiftly grabbing her robe and slipping it on with a determined motion. Evelyn then makes a quick dash toward the bathroom, only to abruptly reverse her course and return to the bed's edge, where she kneels, her fingers tenderly wrapping around Gittes' hand in a moment of heartfelt connection. Responding to her presence, he promptly springs out of bed as well, his movements hurried as he frantically searches through his belongings, eventually finding and pulling on his trousers with quick precision. He swiftly scoops up his shoes, hurriedly dons them, and rushes out of the bedroom, his strides turning into a sprint as he traverses the driveway leading to the garage. Inside the garage, he encounters two vehicles: Mulwray's Buick and Evelyn's Packard. With a decisive motion, Gittes approaches the Buick, opens the passenger door with an assertive tug, and delivers a forceful kick to the right rear taillight using the heel of his shoe, causing the red lens to shatter into pieces. Rising from his crouch, he carefully removes the remaining fragments of the red lens, revealing the bright white light underneath, and discards the broken pieces into a nearby cluster of shrubbery before making a hurried return to the house. Meanwhile, Evelyn is navigating her car along the winding paths of Sunset Boulevard, the vehicle's red and white lights intermittently visible in the night, as Gittes follows in Mulwray's car, maintaining a cautious distance between their two vehicles. He eventually brings the Buick to a stop in front of a modest bungalow house, watching as Evelyn hastily makes her way up the walkway to the front door. Choosing a spot a few yards further down the street, Gittes parks the car near Evelyn's, allowing the engine to idle quietly with the lights switched off. Exiting the car, he treads up the walkway where the curtains are drawn tight, save for a small, uncovered window on the side of the house. Balancing precariously on the edge of the porch, he peers through this window, observing the flurry of activity inside. Inside, Evelyn's Oriental servant is seen rushing through the living room, a space where the windows are shielded by blinds. Gittes shifts his position to a window where the blind is not fully closed, finding a narrow gap of mere inches at the bottom. Through this slender opening, he watches Evelyn pacing back and forth, her movements intermittently disappearing from his line of sight. His attention is soon drawn to the rising figure of Mulwray's girlfriend, who emerges into view from a previously reclining position on a bed. Her face is stained with tears as Evelyn kneels beside her, engaging in a conversation conducted in Spanish. Gittes continues to watch the scene unfold as the servant reappears in the living room, this time carrying a tray laden with a glass and pitcher. Evelyn's insistence grows as she urges the girl to swallow down some pills, which the girl does so reluctantly. Emerging from the house, she heads toward her car and gets in, only to find Gittes already seated there, his gaze fixed on her with a piercing coldness. As Gittes makes a move to exit the car, Evelyn reacts with urgency, grabbing his arm with such vehement force that it nearly results in her screaming, the action effectively completing the tear across the already partially ripped fabric of Gittes' jacket. Their attention momentarily diverted to the jacket, a shared sense of calm washes over them, however brief. In the aftermath, Evelyn's head sinks forward onto the steering wheel, her hair cascading over her face in a curtain of disarray.

test_cases.description: Evelyn quickly gets out of bed, throws on her robe, and starts towards the bathroom before returning to kneel beside the bed, taking Gittes' hand. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. He goes to it and looks balancing on the edge of the porch and sees Evelyn's Oriental servant rushing through the living room of the small house where the windows have blinds. He moves to one where the blind is not completely drawn finding an inch or so of space at the bottom. Evelyn is pacing back and forth in and out of his line of vision. After a moment someone rises into sight obviously from lying on a bed. Mulwray's girlfriend just a few feet from Evelyn. Her tearstained face comes into view as Evelyn kneels and the girl looks up to Evelyn speaking in Spanish. Gittes continues to watch as the servant reemerges through the living room carrying a tray with a glass and pitcher on it. Evelyn insists that the girl swallow down some pills which the girl reluctantly does before emerging from the house going to her car and getting in. Evelyn sees Gittes sitting in her car staring coldly at her. As Gittes starts to get out of the car Evelyn grabs his arm nearly screaming with her intensity actually ripping Gittes' already partially torn jacket. He looks at it and her which has a momentary calming effect on both of them before Evelyn's head sinks onto the steering wheel her hair covering her face.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He tumbles out of the hammock, donning a poncho. Oliver dashes leisurely for the pantry, then returns and sits by the side of the hammock, gripping Harper's foot. Then she tumbles out of the hammock, digs around, and flings on her trousers. She snatches her sandals, slips them on, and meanders out of the den, strolling across the courtyard to the shed. There are two bicycles there: Thompson's Schwinn and Oliver's Raleigh. Harper shifts over to the Schwinn, unlatches the compartment door, and stomps at the left front reflector of the bicycle with the toe of her boot, cracking the blue casing. She rises, gingerly removes the blue casing off the reflector, revealing the yellow glow beneath it, flings the blue casing into the flowerbed, and saunters back toward the barn. Oliver's bicycle glides along the twists on Elm Street, the blue and yellow glimmers popping in and out of sight, with Harper behind the handlebars of Thompson's bicycle, maintaining a cautious gap from Oliver ahead of her. She coasts up before a quaint cabin porch, and he rushes up the path to the main entrance, while she directs the bicycle a few feet further down the road, parking it beside Oliver's, and lets the gears idle with the lanterns off. Harper hops off the bicycle and strides up the path, where the shutters are closed except for one of the narrow apertures on the back of the cabin. She approaches it and peeks, balancing on the edge of the stoop, and glimpses Oliver's French cook bustling through the sitting room of the quaint cabin, where the apertures have screens. She shifts to one where the screen is not completely shut, discovering a sliver of room at the base. Oliver is striding to and fro in and out of her line of sight. Suddenly, someone springs into view, clearly from resting on a loveseat: Thompson's companion, mere inches from Oliver. Her sorrowful expression comes into focus as Oliver sits, and the companion gazes up to Oliver, conversing in Mandarin. Harper continues to gaze as the cook reappears through the sitting room carrying a platter with a cup and jug on it. Oliver insists that the companion gulp down some tablets, which the companion hesitantly does, before departing the cabin, heading to his bicycle, and hopping on. Oliver notices Harper seated on her bicycle, glaring icily at him. As Harper aims to step off the bicycle, Oliver seizes his wrist, almost shrieking, with his fervor actually tearing Harper's already partially frayed coat. She gazes at it and him, which has a fleeting soothing effect on both of them, before Oliver's chin lowers onto the handlebars, his locks veiling his eyes.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Evelyn leaps out of bed, dons a robe, and takes Gittes' hand before he quickly dresses and rushes to the garage. He breaks the taillight of Mulwray's Buick, discards the red lens, and follows Evelyn, who drives her Packard along Sunset Boulevard. Gittes maintains a distance behind her in Mulwray's car. Evelyn stops at a bungalow, and Gittes discreetly observes through a window. Inside, Evelyn's servant hurries through the living room, while Evelyn paces, speaking to Mulwray's tearful girlfriend in Spanish. She insists the girl take some pills. Evelyn leaves the house and sees Gittes in her car. When Gittes exits, Evelyn intensely grabs his arm, tearing his jacket. They both calm momentarily before Evelyn collapses onto the steering wheel, her hair obscuring her face.
